title: I'm a slut, you're a slut
text:
Let's be slutty together...?

It's not a bad word, you know. It just means that we have very healthy sexual appetites, and a lust for sexual adventure.

Or, it might mean that we're sex addicts.

But who cares what we call it? As long as we're honest, upfront, and not hurting anyone: why not be in it together, with a safe shore of a number one to have and to hold as needed and prescribed? Why not have a partner to share all the fun & stories with?

I'd like to find a non-judgmental, open-minded gal to do all of this with. Call it an open relationship or whatever you'd like, but what I'm talking about is building something real and stable and durable between the two of us while acknowledging that sex with just one person for the rest of our lives isn't going to and shouldn't happen.

Yes, there would be rules/guidelines that we'd hash out in advance. Yes, we'd be safe and sane and only bring home smiles and ideas--nothing yucky or wrong.

So who am I when I'm not being slutty?

I'm loving, affectionate, quick-witted, very cute, super fit, a creature of the world. I like books and movies and seeking out new and unusual urban flora and fauna. I'm a city-dweller and have a great day job that allows me to chase my decidedly non-capitalistic aims.

If you're in the same boat, and you'd like to meet up and talk about all the lovely & intense possibilities of slut-plus-slut in person, please drop me a line! Tell me about you, what you're looking for, and including a pic will get mine in return.

Thanks for reading my post, and stay warm out there! (Pro tip: it's easier when you're snuggling in bed with another person or two.)

title: Dont know why I'm still single...
text:
I am highly educated and well traveled (albeit mostly in North America - more as a result of convenience, political/social turmoil and economics than any thing else). You will find me quite knowledgeable and a lot of fun. I have a cocker spaniel (am a dog person - although cats and babies adore me), have two master's degrees (but who's counting - am pursuing a third) and am six credits away from a doctorate (although writing the dissertation has proven to be somewhat daunting). I am very passionate about leaving the world a better place than it was when I arrived...(actually I am quite passionate in other ways as well - blushing bashfully).

I happen to think I am a great guy who deserves a great gal (such as yourself perhaps?)

As for me, I am a mature 5'6" 150 # HWP trimmed haired SWM (divorced) who meets most peoples criteria for a suitable mate (car, own place, has real teeth which I brush & floss, bathes, no smoking, drugs or alcohol use - I like to feel in control of my body, no criminal record, STI free, self confident, not rich but getting by just fine, happy, loving and supportive). I need to make sure that we have an intellectual/interpersonal connection before doing the selfie thing. 

I wrote the following (with modifications) for my profile on a dating site. It gives a pretty good feel for who I am and what I am seeking. If after you have read my essay and think you would be interested in our getting to know each other, write back. 

Essay begins here ;)

I am fun, very smart, have a HUGE sense of humor, and a little careful about who I meet and about whom I invest my heart and time, been hurt, lied to, and "played" - and have made some very large mistakes (from which I have learned valuable "life lessons" and intend to never repeat) which has resulted in my becoming wiser as well as more caring. I am completely honest, but tend to keep my cards close to my heart.

I am the one that women want to talk to as a real "best friend", but it gets old when they talk about getting played and say to me, "you are such a great guy, you would never do that to me" and it's true. I would like to meet someone nice, perhaps normal-ish who has her head together.

Ultimately I am seeking someone who understands that sharing their life with that special someone is more important than whether the toilet paper unfurls from the top or the bottom. However, I understand that romance takes time (and is much more interesting if the two of us share in growing our romance together) and although I am not looking for just one date, I would be very happy to be in the company of a interesting woman who's inner beauty and strength flows from within her. I would like to go out for a simple casual old fashion date and just spend time with one another (even better if we put our cell phones away for just one night).

If you would like to date a real man who's professional, educated, romantic, kind, spiritually centered, compassionate, loving, and just a very nice guy all around write back to me.

A bit more about my personality: I wish to meet someone special to share my life with. Living a healthy romantic fun life with that person and through the future we build together; for now I think it would be very nice to develop a friendship with a great lady and just relax. I enjoy biking, hiking and generally anything out of doors and am also a voracious reader. I have a very well developed sense of humor and love to joke and just live in the moment. I am very hard working, but now seek balance between professional life and personal life.

Goals: to finish my doctorate, to become one of them there hob-nob uppity professor type people, to find where I put my glasses, car keys and coffee cup (a daily ritual for me)...as well as the ever migrating cell phone thingy along with the magically disappearing charger.

Why I am unique: I am a lot of fun, and am not really one of those hooty-tooty smarty pants types. I enjoy life and I look forward to the magic of each sun rise and each sun set; sometime I like to do the same for Venus and the moon depending upon my sleep cycle. Most people who know me will tell you that they cannot stop smiling.

Am divorced with little drama outside of my being blessed with a y-chromosome (I "suffer" from 'guyness') highly educated intelligent hardworking professional, very independent, huge sense of humor and very fun loving. Enjoy sharing myself, somewhat mischievous, but never mean; very considerate - I treat a lady like a lady. I am a non-smoker, do not drink, do not do drugs (I thought 420 was the name of a highway), and I love to touch and be touched.

I was reading some of dating sites profiles and many woman have a huge set of "deal breakers" and I thought perhaps I would just list things about me up front to avoid the awkward "red flag" thing other women write about...also I find human behavior to be exceedingly interesting and often amusing so here are my thoughts about why I am defective in some way shape or form...(besides being born and raised male - which is a completely obvious deficiency). I don't own or ride a motor cycle which for many midwestern women is a minimal requirement for a healthy long term relationship...and I quote, "seeking honest non-superficial man for deeply emotional heart felt loving long term relationship - must be taller than Micheal Jordan, be tatooed like Dennis Rodman and must own a Harley" (vroom vroom) - I have thought of buying a moped to try to do my part for the environment (I am a self-professed dork) which I know is a total chick magnet (putt putt putt....picture blue smoke or something).

What other deal breakers might I have in store for you: I watched some of the Star Trek I know who "Dr. Who" is; I listen to NPR (gasp); I can spell; I like science (I also teach math and science); I can count to twenty -- with my shoes on! - sometimes I forget why I was counting to twenty, I can say my "A,B,C"s but I sometimes say them out of order just to watch peoples' expressions; I am not sure if Tofu is a food or a form of carpet padding - maybe it should be a shoe insert; frog legs do NOT taste like chicken - they taste like frog; yellow snow does not taste like a lemon slushy - don't ask; I have to look in the mirror when I shave so my nose remains attached ; I tie my own neckties but feel awkward wearing one; I know how to ask for directions but am pretty sure that we are not lost so there is no need to ask for directions; I like American "cuisine" but have a clear understanding that it would be healthier to eat mud; I enjoy observing people - not all people enjoy being observed; I refuse to drop what I am doing to answer the phone just because someone who wasn't busy at the moment called - unless it is you calling me (of course); I think that some kids are too entitled and perhaps some parents should say "No" once each decade or so; I like my sushi cooked and there is no way I will ever swallow a raw oyster (again); I once climbed a mountain - only to realized that one has to also "climb down" the mountain; title: Are you a Pixie Gal?
text:
Where is my pixie gal? 

Let's go shopping all day Saturday at garden centers and roam the countryside looking for pick it yourself corn on the cob and other wonderful fresh from the field goodies. Then head home or to a friends house to create a grand meal of simple foods. Sitting around for hours talking about this or that outside on the back patio. If the mood strikes us, head out late at night to find a theatre showing Rocky Horror Picture Show. Sunday will be up and out for a walk in the forest preserve to see how many deer we can see. Then off to an off the beat outdoor cafe to watch the world go by and talk to anyone around. The week will drag us back to our normal lives, but we will make time to go check out a show or music performance at the local high school at some point in the week. 

I would love to live in the "country" and have some land with a stream running through it, but be close enough to town that friends would make the trip to come and have dinner or hang out on a random night during the week. title: You need me more than I need you
text:
Yes, you need me more than I need you. I'll say it again. You need me more than I need you.

Let's drop the pretense. I'm here looking for someone as much as you are. There is a difference though. I'm 36 and while I'm single, I'm alright with that. I know that I most likely won't ever find the woman to be completely everything I desire, and I've accepted that. Have you accepted the same?

I'm sure that you're intelligent, kind, open minded and attractive, aren't we all? Don't we all strive to find someone who has all of the qualities that we think we deserve? You know what, I can get nearly the same things from online porn and video games. No, they obviously don't compare to having a warm body of someone I care next to me or sex every night (most likely in your case once a week if I'd been good), but they don't reject me because I don't live up to their expectations. They won't keep me warm at night, but they do occasionally make me smile and laugh. I accept that if I never find the right woman, I'll still be just fine. Can you say the same?

What do you want? A man who is caring? A man who is good looking? A man who's wealthy? All three? Do you honestly think you'll find him here? There isn't going to be that storybook romance you expect to find. Believe me. Or are you really looking for a man who will pay for your dinners and have sex when you want it? You want him to open doors for you and protect you, but at the same time you claim to want to be an equal partner in the relationship. You want an idealized 1950's man, yet you refuse to even consider the part of an idealized 1950's woman.

Think hard and long about what you want. You're welcome to send me your hate filled responses. They will only prove my point. You and I came here looking for the same things. Don't pretend we didn't. The only difference is that if I never find what I'm looking for here, I'll still be happy with who I am.

I will say it once more and for the last time. You need me more than I need you.

title: My 4 S's of dating: sarcasm, stability, sex and sports
text:
Sports, sarcasm, sex and stability.

Those are a few things that I find important when I am dating or looking for someone to date. There is more of course, but this is craigslist, might as well put it out there. Let me explain.

Sports - I am a sports fan and like to watch and play. I am not the huge fan that it takes it over my life, but I do like to go out and watch a game, like to follow my Cubs and Bears, play golf and basketball and overall like all sports. I would like to find someone who likes sports every once in a while and maybe knows a thing or two...even better if she plays golf.

Sarcasm - I have a good sense of humor and it tends to be sarcastic. I love a girl that is sarcastic and can give it right back to me and someone who can handle taking it. It is nice sarcasm, none of that mean stuff.

Sex - I am not looking for a one night stand or and booty calls, I do want to find someone to date, but with that being said, sexual chemistry is so important in a relationship. I am looking for someone who agrees with that and someone who is comfortable with their own sexuality and talking about it. Someone who is anywhere from traditional to experimental, someone who likes kissing as much as a night of ripping off clothes and someone who knows what she likes and wants to know what I like.

Stability - I have my life pretty well together and would like to find someone that is the same. I am also looking for something that has the chance to at least turn into a good dating situation and take it from there. We all have our issues and problems and little drama, but I would like someone who doesn't get caught up in it, look for it or let it drag them down. So that is what the title meant. Other than that, I am a tall 39 year old, I am easy going, laid back, funny, educated, attractive, honest, open, fun, mature, goofy and normal. title: Intellectual Seeks Same
text:
Hi there, I've decided to try putting my wishes out here into the CL universe in the hope of meeting a truly compatible lady. Despite the incredible sleaze factor, I know there are lonely, bored people such as myself who click through these posts in the wee hours, perhaps fantasizing about hitting the lottery of the dating game and finding that perfect match. Well, here is an authentic potential "dream come true" for the right lady.

Who is that right lady? Well, I think it's unrealistic to expect to meet someone who fits an exact list of criteria. I've been with women who had all the attributes I thought were "essential" at the time, but there are intangible qualities that maybe only exist in the chemistry between two people. So I think it's better to be surprised; to hope to meet someone unexpected. Someone whom I couldn't have imagined because I've never met someone like her before. At our age people tend to think they've seen it all, which is a shame. If you've seen it all then why go on?

I think a minimal compatibility list would amount to: someone like me who could like someone like me. So let me list what I believe to be my desirable qualities:

Intelligent

Hence the title of this post. In the long run most of what we do together involves talking and sharing ideas. I'm very honest, straightforward, and compassionate. I like to talk and I like being quiet. I think conversation is the heart of a good relationship. So someone who is smart enough to recognize and respect my intelligence, and can offer me the same in return, would be essential. I'm pretty well rounded, having travelled physically as well as spiritually. I'm interesting, funny, and insightful. I have lots of stories and I'd like to hear yours.

Horny

Just as important as intelligence. Yeah, yeah, yeah... I know, crude, vulgar, "just like all the other guys". Well, yes and no; but if this is your attitude about sex you may not like me. I'm the attentive lover some women dream of. My hands and lips will be on you often. If this doesn't work for you then we have nothing more to discuss. No more cold fish in my life, thank you.

This doesn't mean I'll be impatient to bed you though. I need a level of comfort and intimacy before I can get naked with someone. Sometimes this comes quickly, sometimes it takes a while. We don't even need to discuss it before you're ready, but this is your advance warning. If you respond to this post I'm going to assume you've read it and know that I'm only interested in an uninhibited, reciprocal partner. Someone I can't wait to see because I know she can't wait to see me. If this makes your heart flutter then give serious thought to responding to this post immediately.

Attractive

Yes, beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and I do have eclectic tastes, so I'm not ruling any possibilities out. I do however think that couples should "look right" together. A man who's not that good looking shouldn't be with a woman that every guy looks at, and vice versa. But looks are subjective; some think I'm gorgeous and others are unimpressed. The basic stats:

5' 7" tall - about 150 lbs
Brown hair, brown eyes, and a "classic profile" (which I can't see but have been complimented on)
I'm Mixed Ethnicity
Usually dress casual, neat and clean. But clothes look good on me for some reason. If I wear a shirt with a collar I look "dressed up". I tend to favor solid colors and a no-frills style.

The women I usually find attractive are around 5' 4" tall and let's say, 140 lbs or so. I like a woman who wears heels (in bed at least, if nowhere else). Not hard and fast rules, but generally what I find attractive. If you qualify as "sexy" (meaning guys notice you on the street) then I might find your looks appealing. I'm not that fussy, and I like "quirky" good looks as well as "classic". So sending a photo with your reply is the best way to find out. You will get mine in return.

I don't want to sound too arrogant, but I am a fairly handsome man, so if you're not at least "pretty" then please don't put me on the spot. You don't have to be gorgeous, but at least be pretty.

Beyond the above...

Okay... covered the "essentials" of brains, sexuality, and looks. What else?

Good heartedness!

I'm a good guy. I'm honest and forthcoming. I'm kind to children and animals.
I don't like to argue and don't want to be involved with someone who has a violent temper or regularly raises her voice. If you can't have a reasonable discussion about an issue that needs to be resolved without raising your voice, then you're not someone I can be around. I'm not saying that impassioned expression is forbidden, but there's a limit. If you're shouting you're definitely not listening, and violence is not always physical.

Other facts

Since I haven't said it outright, I will say it here: I am single... very, very single.
One woman man looking for a one man woman.
I live alone in The West Loop and Work in Downtown Chicago
I have a car and I'm willing to travel

And where is this all leading?

Well... I'm a relationship kinda guy and monogamous by nature. I'm happiest when I'm involved with one woman, and one woman is all I have the capacity for dealing with at a time. I'd love to find the love of the rest of my life, but I don't want to approach you with expectations of any kind. My last relationship was 90% wonderful for 2 years until that last 10% became such an issue that we had to part. So let's just say that what I really want is someone to live with forever and ever, and that I'm willing to make the investment of time and emotion to make that happen. I want to love and be loved, but this can not be planned, only hoped for. I'm willing to try and, hopefully, what you read here will show that I'm sincere.

What to do now...

Well - Write me. No need to be as verbose as I am here. I don't care to have an extensive written correspondence. I'd like to get to know a bit about you via email and phone, then meet in the near future. If you have "other irons in the fire" (meaning, other guys you're currently flirting with) I think it's best you decide to do them or drop them before you start flirting with me. Even at the dating stage, I can only focus on one woman at a time, and I don't like being in a competition. If I want a second date with you, that means I see a potential that I want to pursue, and I will play that out to the end before my interests drift towards another woman. So put your juggling aside for a moment if you're going to pique my interest.

I understand if you don't want to send a picture right away, but don't waste my time either. I will want to see what you look like before even talking on the phone. And if you have this "thing" about where your picture goes out in the world, get over it. It's just a picture - if you have nothing to hide then don't hide anything. I went on one dating site and they used my picture countless times. I felt violated at first, but then I realized - so what? This is the world we live in. Facebook knows more about you than your mother ever did. I'm not Facebook, not a "picture collector", I just want to see the face and figure that go along with the words before I start getting interested in a woman's mind. Fair enough?

Well... thanks for reading. Expect this post to be available until someone suitable finds me.

Have fun and be safe.

I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about becoming a 'sugar daddy'' (I hate the term. . .) to one younger and lovely woman. I am 42 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being in her her 20's and someone who has some attraction to an older man. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a casual relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . title: Looking for a travel companion
text:
In September I am going on a vacation trip to Acadia National Park in Bar Harbor Maine with an organized travel group. Prior to meeting the group in Maine, I am going to spend some time visiting the Canadian Maritime Provinces.

I plan to leave the Chicago area on Wednesday, September 7th. My route will include sightseeing in Toronto, ON, Montreal, QC, Quebec, QC, Charlottetown, PE, Cheticamp, NS, Halifax, NS, and St John, NB. I plan to leave Canada in time to arrive at Acadia National Park in Bar Harbor, ME on Saturday, September 17th.

The group I am meeting will be staying in Acadia National Park from Saturday, September 17th until Wednesday, September 21st. All activities available during this vacation are optional and will include hiking, biking, kayaking, sightseeing, antiquing, shopping, road touring, and enjoying seafood fresh from the Atlantic Ocean. There are currently 9 group members signed up for the trip, but that number could change. 

I plan to leave Bar Harbor for the return trip on Thursday, September 22nd. My return route will follow a US route through the New England states, along the southern shore of Lake Erie, and then across Ohio and Indiana. I expect to arrive in the Chicago area on Sunday, September 25th.

During the trip I will be staying at full facility camp grounds in a Scamp travel trailer that has all the amenities of a one room apartment including a stove, microwave, refrigerator, sink, furnace, air conditioner, television, two beds, and a bathroom with a hot shower.

I'm looking for a travel companion to share the fun of this trip with me; I am not looking for a long term romantic relationship, or a friend with benefits. Your expenses will include getting to our departure point, all of your meals, entry fees, personal purchases, and a negotiated portion of travel costs. If you are interested in sharing this vacation trip, let's first meet for coffee and conversation to determine if we are socially compatible and can spend time together on an extended driving trip.
interests: Camping, Foreign Travel, Archaeology, American History, Playing Music

title: Do you need to be taken in hand?
text:
What I want is not meant for everyone, nor is it meant to offend you. I am not judgmental about what others seek. Everyone knows in their heart what makes them happy, and after over 30 years, I know what that is for me.

First and foremost, I seek a partner. I want a woman to share my life. I want one woman, not two, three or a half dozen. I have no interest in having multiple partners, be them secret or not from each other. Everything in a relationship, not just the type that I desire, has to be based on trust and loyalty. That is not something I will ever compromise on.

I want a partner with whom I can guide her and help her through her life as she can help me. I want someone who will challenge me to become a better person. I want someone who enjoys both going out to dinner and movie as well as just staying home and cuddling under a nice warm blanket.

I'm 5'11" and thin. I've lived on the northside of Chicago for just over a year now after being up in the burbs for two. I adore movies and Japanese food. I have a good job, my own home and my own car. I hold open doors and am very polite.

These are not hard line items I seek in a partner, but they are what I prefer:
Around my age or younger. Height/Weight proportionate. Has a decent job or goes to school. Has transportation. Is open minded. Race is unimportant.

I know I will probably be flagged or get a lot of people hating me for this but I don't give a flying fig.
I am sincere and genuine in what I am looking for here and open to discussing my situation as an adult.

Let me first and foremost say that I am successful, intelligent, charming, strong willed, endearing, come from a nice family, sweet, artistic, creative, fun, musically inclined, and probably the most well-rounded individual you will meet on Craigslist. You probably won't believe I would write such an ad on here.

However, I am in a LTR relationship that is in a complete downward spiral. 

I work very hard in my industry, mostly Nights as my "significant other" of 10 years works hard in her industry mostly day shifts. We never have time for each other and we rarely do anything fun anymore.

I cannot leave this current situation due to finances and just plain not wanting to change up my lifestyle. It would be so uncomfortable.
There's formalities such as billing addresses, technology and services that are all in my name, shared bank accounts, Car payments as cosigners, house payments, and fighting over pets we both have gotten attached to, etc.

I need to feel alive again. I need to feel the passion and the excitement of meeting a new woman. Calling and texting a sensual female and having my insides jump for joy and feel numb to the rest of the world.
It would be so nice to be able to write love poems and sing love songs and dance with a woman who I feel a connection with.
I need to feel close emotionally, mentally and physically.

I don't want this to be a disgusting situation that is casual or based solely on sex.
However, on the other side of the spectrum a "FWB" situation with Friendship being the key word sounds immature and so weird to me and so typical of what most men are asking for these days.

`I wish there was a positive label for what I am trying to set up here. Something more than a FWB but less than a wife cause of my current situation.

We can go out to shows, plays, musicals, movies, concerts, museums. We can travel the country on long road trips (I will say business trips). We can go to sporting events and festivals.
I want to feel romance again. And the physical will come naturally.

Maybe you are a woman in her 30s in the same boat and don't wish to change your situation either. Maybe you are a younger woman just out of college who sees this as an adventure in which you are focusing on your career and not having to commit much to me other than our dating. 
Maybe you are a mature woman in your 40s+ who does not mind my situation and you are an empty nester who needs passion again in your life.

Whatever the case may be if you feel inclined to chat, take a chance and email me.
At worst we can be friends.

Just take the time to get to know me and not be judgmental. I promise to do the same.

title: Intellectual Seeks Same
text:
Hi there, I've decided to try putting my wishes out here into the CL universe in the hope of meeting a truly compatible lady. Despite the incredible sleaze factor, I know there are lonely, bored people such as myself who click through these posts in the wee hours, perhaps fantasizing about hitting the lottery of the dating game and finding that perfect match. Well, here is an authentic potential "dream come true" for the right lady.

Who is that right lady? Well, I think it's unrealistic to expect to meet someone who fits an exact list of criteria. I've been with women who had all the attributes I thought were "essential" at the time, but there are intangible qualities that maybe only exist in the chemistry between two people. So I think it's better to be surprised; to hope to meet someone unexpected. Someone whom I couldn't have imagined because I've never met someone like her before. At our age people tend to think they've seen it all, which is a shame. If you've seen it all then why go on?

I think a minimal compatibility list would amount to: someone like me who could like someone like me. So let me list what I believe to be my desirable qualities:

Intelligent

Hence the title of this post. In the long run most of what we do together involves talking and sharing ideas. I'm very honest, straightforward, and compassionate. I like to talk and I like being quiet. I think conversation is the heart of a good relationship. So someone who is smart enough to recognize and respect my intelligence, and can offer me the same in return, would be essential. I'm pretty well rounded, having travelled physically as well as spiritually. I'm interesting, funny, and insightful. I have lots of stories and I'd like to hear yours.

Horny

Just as important as intelligence. Yeah, yeah, yeah... I know, crude, vulgar, "just like all the other guys". Well, yes and no; but if this is your attitude about sex you may not like me. I'm the attentive lover some women dream of. My hands and lips will be on you often. If this doesn't work for you then we have nothing more to discuss. No more cold fish in my life, thank you.

This doesn't mean I'll be impatient to bed you though. I need a level of comfort and intimacy before I can get naked with someone. Sometimes this comes quickly, sometimes it takes a while. We don't even need to discuss it before you're ready, but this is your advance warning. If you respond to this post I'm going to assume you've read it and know that I'm only interested in an uninhibited, reciprocal partner. Someone I can't wait to see because I know she can't wait to see me. If this makes your heart flutter then give serious thought to responding to this post immediately.

Attractive

Yes, beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and I do have eclectic tastes, so I'm not ruling any possibilities out. I do however think that couples should "look right" together. A man who's not that good looking shouldn't be with a woman that every guy looks at, and vice versa. But looks are subjective; some think I'm gorgeous and others are unimpressed. The basic stats:

5' 7" tall - about 150 lbs
Brown hair, brown eyes, and a "classic profile" (which I can't see but have been complimented on)
I'm Mixed Ethnicity
Usually dress casual, neat and clean. But clothes look good on me for some reason. If I wear a shirt with a collar I look "dressed up". I tend to favor solid colors and a no-frills style.

he women I usually find attractive are around 5' 4" tall and let's say, 140 lbs or so. I like a woman who wears heels (in bed at least, if nowhere else). Not hard and fast rules, but generally what I find attractive. If you qualify as "sexy" (meaning guys notice you on the street) then I might find your looks appealing. I'm not that fussy, and I like "quirky" good looks as well as "classic". So sending a photo with your reply is the best way to find out. You will get mine in return.

I don't want to sound too arrogant, but I am a fairly handsome man, so if you're not at least "pretty" then please don't put me on the spot. You don't have to be gorgeous, but at least be pretty.

Beyond the above...

Okay... covered the "essentials" of brains, sexuality, and looks. What else?

Good heartedness!

I'm a good guy. I'm honest and forthcoming. I'm kind to children and animals.
I don't like to argue and don't want to be involved with someone who has a violent temper or regularly raises her voice. If you can't have a reasonable discussion about an issue that needs to be resolved without raising your voice, then you're not someone I can be around. I'm not saying that impassioned expression is forbidden, but there's a limit. If you're shouting you're definitely not listening, and violence is not always physical.

Other facts

Since I haven't said it outright, I will say it here: I am single... very, very single.
One woman man looking for a one man woman.
I live alone in The West Loop and Work in Downtown Chicago
I have a car and I'm willing to travel

And where is this all leading?

Well... I'm a relationship kinda guy and monogamous by nature. I'm happiest when I'm involved with one woman, and one woman is all I have the capacity for dealing with at a time. I'd love to find the love of the rest of my life, but I don't want to approach you with expectations of any kind. My last relationship was 90% wonderful for 2 years until that last 10% became such an issue that we had to part. So let's just say that what I really want is someone to live with forever and ever, and that I'm willing to make the investment of time and emotion to make that happen. I want to love and be loved, but this can not be planned, only hoped for. I'm willing to try and, hopefully, what you read here will show that I'm sincere.

What to do now...

Well - Write me. No need to be as verbose as I am here. I don't care to have an extensive written correspondence. I'd like to get to know a bit about you via email and phone, then meet in the near future. If you have "other irons in the fire" (meaning, other guys you're currently flirting with) I think it's best you decide to do them or drop them before you start flirting with me. Even at the dating stage, I can only focus on one woman at a time, and I don't like being in a competition. If I want a second date with you, that means I see a potential that I want to pursue, and I will play that out to the end before my interests drift towards another woman. So put your juggling aside for a moment if you're going to pique my interest.

I understand if you don't want to send a picture right away, but don't waste my time either. I will want to see what you look like before even talking on the phone. And if you have this "thing" about where your picture goes out in the world, get over it. It's just a picture - if you have nothing to hide then don't hide anything. I went on one dating site and they used my picture countless times. I felt violated at first, but then I realized - so what? This is the world we live in. Facebook knows more about you than your mother ever did. I'm not Facebook, not a "picture collector", I just want to see the face and figure that go along with the words before I start getting interested in a woman's mind. Fair enough?

Well... thanks for reading. Expect this post to be available until someone suitable finds me.

Have fun and be safe.

title: I am Married But I am Looking For More
text:
First things first: I'm married and we have a child. If this blows me out of your moral waters, please move on. Not looking to offend anyone, so if you find this offensive, please stop reading and leave. 

If I feel the need to be here, why don't I just do the stand-up thing and level with my wife and end my marriage? Because I don't consider tearing my family apart, putting my child through that, to be the stand-up thing to do. That would be putting my own needs ahead of my child's, and I'm not willing to do that (call it a rationalization, or whatever, but I don't buy into the "the kids are much better off in a split household" theory - THAT is a rationalization if ever I heard one). Besides, perhaps someday things will change within the marriage, and I won't feel the need to be here. But for now, that's not going to happen. I've tried. It's not going to happen now. 

So what am I here for? Simple -- Passion. I want to connect. I want to re-experience intensity. Yes - sure I want to fuck, too. I'm a guy in a virtually sexless marriage, so yes - I want sex. But I want more, too. I want a friend and a confidante. I want to feel. I want to be excited. I want to shudder with anticipation. I want to feel you shudder. I want to burn, even if it will lead to pain (hopefully no more than my own, but please know the risks going in). 

So who am I looking for? Well, logically, it would seem a married woman in the same situation. But logic often has little to do with what will work best, so if you are single/divorced, etc., and curious/horny/lonely/just want to reach out to someone, feel free to contact me. We can talk, at a minimum. Perhaps you're sick of the whole dating scene/been searching for so long, and want something simpler. Or you are still searching for that "one" for you, but until you find him, are willing to spend some time in a relationship with no real future for you. I don't know. But neither will you, unless you try. So please do. Write to me. Talk to me. And perhaps more will develop. Or perhaps not. But I'm real. I'll be real with you. And I expect/want the same

title: A 25,000 RING, WILL YOU MARRY ME?
text:
Thank you for stopping by, I'm glad the title caught your attention. I tend to write a lot, so be prepared for a long read...

It's a beautiful morning, the house smells like sausage and coffee, I'm on my second cup, CNN is on in the background and I thought I'd post an ad to see if maybe perhaps I could find love :) LOL - Of course we would start off as friends and get to know each other and see what happens from there. No green card marriages please, unless you're super hot and want a real relationship.

I've been reading these posts for a while now and all I can do is shake my head at what this world has come to. I constantly see guys posting sugar-daddy ads and benefactor ads. 

Are there any decent men or women out there anymore I wonder to myself? I know these days a lot of women only go for the really good looking tall, dark and handsome guys. Funny thing is, most, if not all of these tall, dark and handsome men end up cheating on them or just use them for sex and treat them like dirt. I am not assuming this, I know this to be true because I have girlfriends who tell me. 

Now don't worry, although I am no Brad Pitt, I'm no Danny DeVito either..lol. I'm just an average uy next door who is very confident with his looks. I'm in my 30's, clean cut with no facial hair and a whole of fun!

I'm one of those guys who is truly a hopeless romantic. I already have my wedding day planned out if and when it ever happens...lol. I'm serious...a small to medium sized intimate wedding at a very nice resort like The Montage in Laguna Beach, or even somewhere exotic like Venice, Italy or even Tahiti, depending on what my future wife wants of course :). My wedding song would be an oldie but a goldie. Shania Twain's From This Moment On. Speaking of Shania, whenever I listen to her music, it brings me great joy and lifts me up and I fantasize about being married in a perfect marriage and how I finally have stopped searching for my mate. I have these dreams sometimes where I am married or in a great relationship and I get this overall feeling of great happiness. Its like feeling complete, its like I have finally found what I was searching for. You're gonna laugh but I watched this movie with my niece a while back called the Lizzie McGuire Movie and it had this really upbeat song. I think its called, "What Dreams are Made of". It goes something like this: 

I've got somewhere I belong 

I've got somebody to love 

This is what dreams are made of

I always think to myself, how lucky one must be to find that kind of love. Rent the movie, its really cute. And no, Im not gay, Im just not afraid to use that word and show my emotions and share my feelings. You're really going laugh when I tell you that I LOVE to drive fast on the freeway and rock out in the car while singing that song! LOL 

As to what I like: I am really into chick flicks, I also like action and brain-dead movies as well, but chick flicks are my fave. I also like to travel. Traveling is my all-time favorite thing to do. Whether it be on a weekend getaway to Big Bear, San Francisco (wine-tasting in Napa!), or a weekend in Vegas, I just love being out and about. Internationally, I have been to Europe and Asia and I plan on returning with YOU! Around town, I enjoy fine dining, movies, shopping, hiking, jogging, etc. 

I am financially secure and am very blessed to be a homeowner in and drive a few decent cars. Although I like nice things, I actually OWN my car and its not all some fake facade like most people these days with their leased c-class Mercedes on a zero down 84 month lease..lol 

Wow...are you still reading? If you are and you would like to meet a truly nice guy who is looking to meet a nice woman, please feel free to email me. 

As to the type of women I am attracted to: 

On the inside: 1) Honesty, without honesty, we have nothing. 

On the outside: Because I am not a big guy myself, I typically date short/petite women in their 20s to 30s. If you are able to walk around Disney-world with me, you are in unconditionally :) 

As for me: 

I am in my 30's, I'm clean cut, average build and a whole lot of fun!. I think if you have read every word of this ad, you already know whats on the inside : ) 

I know this is a long shot, but those are the type of bets I love to place in Vegas...Lol. Let's start with a chat on the phone, a quick bite, then upgrade to a day in Disney world and then Italy next summer where I'd propose to you in St. Peter's square and then dance under the stars with your tears of joy falling on my shoulders....that or have an awkward plane ride home...Lol again

Thanks for reading and feel free to attach a picture if you decide to say hello :) 

If you happen to be reading this ad from outside of IL and you're on the same page as I am in life, I would love for you to send me an email and tell me about yourself. Perhaps Sleepless in Seattle has me fantasizing about meeting some women from clear across the country...See, I told you I was a hopeless romantic :)

Just so I know you'e not a computer trying to sell me something, type in the name of your favorite ride in Disney World in the subject line of your email.

title: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies
text:
I wonder if the magic spark can ever come back into my life? I often think about it........from time to time. Perhaps you might be thinking the same thing. 
Being a full time Single Dad, I have to admit, I truly love my child and there is nothing like it in this world. Simply nothing. 

My life is pretty normal. I take care of myself and my child to the best of my ability. My favorite store is Mariano's. I speak 3 languages and I am a pretty good cook. What I lack is a good woman who understands me and accepts me and my child for the lost souls that we are. 

Its funny but, it is finding that one person that when I look at her, words are hard to come out of my mouth. When I sit next to her, there is no need for words. Simply look into her eyes and two hearts feel it without one single word. Is it over for me? 
Is it even possible to find, or rediscover, and feel love again .
Is touching her going to be just as incredible as it once was in my life? 
Will my heart go nuts with a simple kiss? 
Will she have that effect on me?............Desire. 

How do we find that one? I Love dating.. When we were younger, it was SO easy to meet then let things all fall into place. Now, we put up all sorts of obstacles. 

My dream is to one day meet a female at a coffee shop and I find the courage to say, "excuse me, you are really pretty and I am finding it hard not to say anything". Would she smile, would she tell me where to go or would she simply look at me as if I was a ok? 
Do we go to a bar and flirt? Do we go to a restaurant and chat? Do we post something online? Do we try Internet dating? Who the heck knows? 
Me? I am a happy, well grounded, and content Dad. It would seem that I don't really need anything in my life. BUT, there is always that 'time', when I am alone that I think to myself, "could it be different'? I am stable, secure and most weeks, there are a couple of days I get lonely and find myself reading through these posts and wonder what it would be like to have someone come over for a drink and get to know each other. I think about it each week and do nothing about it. Today I am writing my thoughts on here. Obviously, there is a gap in my life. I have no clue what to do or how to do it........ I mean, filling that gap. 
What kind of Female do I truly adore? Being honest, that is easy for me to share: I love my female to be........... 
Stunning in my eyes both inside her heart and outside.... 
Extremely kind hearted, spiritual, and LOVES to feel true love........ 
Incredible at listening and communicating with everyone she comes into contact with.....
She loves and adores her family and ALWAYS puts them first..... 
She is well educated and a hard worker who sets goals and achieves them... 
Her integrity is through the roof and her friends/peers respect her..... 
She is down to earth, self-confident and can hold her own in any given situation.... 
as hers do
someway, bring her into my life, slowly, gently, most beautifully and most understandingly. 
True love. Is it still out there for those of us who are single ? 
If you took the time to read this dreary yet emotional outpouring, responses are not only welcome, they are desired.
I am ready to open up a part of my world that I closed off after my divorce. Why did I do that? I am not sure . A relationship at times doesn't seem possible BUT, if two people can start off with a deep desire to see each other once or even twice a week, that alone is so much better than not at all or sitting at home thinking about it. 
Just thoughts and desires. I have often thought about using a dating site but have not done that. If you have done that and had success, please let me know which ones to try. I would like to be a great addition to someone's life. Especially if you are close to your parents. 

Thank you for reading. I feel pretty nice getting my feelings out. As a Guy we are thought not to talk about stuff like this but I feel free now and I am to be able to write this , Although we may never meet, there is a tiny chance, we will. If you answered 'yes, that's me', to my little wish list, then we really should chat here. 
I am spiritual, spontaneous, ambitious yet non-materialistic, and truly try to seriously achieve all my goals. I am attractive, moderately attractive , caring, passionate, well educated and I have traveled a lot both here and overseas. I feel I have lots to offer the right female. So, to wrap this long thing up, what am I sure about? 
I hope one day to be wrapped up in someone's arms that I don't want to be without. When we ask ourselves one question, we get all the answers we need. That question is simple: Imagine my life with her in it. Now imagine my life without her in it. Which? 
Thank you kindly for reading. I hope I touched one heart that is in the same place as mine.
I leave you with one last thought......One heart. With so many people in this entire world, why, oh why is it SO hard to find our ONE HEART?
I don't want to give up on believing I can find you and you, me. 
YESTERDAY IS HISTORY , TOMORROW A MYSTERY, AND TODAY A GIFT.

text:
Giving this a try in the hope of find someone sane and like minded to share a new relationship.

It makes sense to me that in a May-December type of romance such as this that an older and established man should take care of his younger lover in many ways--including financially. I am quite good at what I do in my career and sufficiently proud of my success without undo arrogance and I hope this in part recommends me as new friend or more. I would love to find a part-time companion and partner in crime for reciprocal spoiling and an all around good time.

And so, in short: I am a successful male thinking about trying something out of the ordinary to one younger and lovely woman. I am 33 years old and I would be interested in my new friend being over 18 and someone who has some attraction to an older man. I suggest this in part because part of what should draw a younger woman to an older man should be his success and ability to provide support of all kinds, it makes sense to me.

I am not necessarily interested in anything serious but I would like for us to enjoy each other and for our affection to be genuine. This means that I am really looking for someone with whom I have mutual chemistry and someone who will enjoy her time with me as I hope to with her. This would be a causal relationship where we each spoil each other in our own capacities.

I am looking for the sort of woman who knows the strength of her own intellect, owns her own sexuality and sees some merit in having an older and generous gentlemen in her corner and possibly in her bed. Someone who knows that men and women are equal (certainly) but also celebrates the differences that biology, time and society have instilled in the respective genders. I do prefer to be 'captain of the ship' so to speak and I would very much welcome a capable and charming 'first mate' as it were (no pun is intended).

I am respectful, attractive and a consummate gentleman. The idea of being a sort of a patron to a smart, sweet younger lady is very much a turn-on for me. I hope to find a lady who shares this sentiment and would enjoy the idea of being on the arm, and possibly in the bed, of an older, clever and also sweet gentleman.

I want to say that while this affair will have a sexual component I am interested in connection that is not just about . Hopefully you can appreciate the romance in this idea and are not solely motivated by the pampering. Are you are as eager to be appreciated for your mind as well as your body? I think if we are a good match this will be an excellent experience for us both.

Finally I can say that I am quite discerning in choosing a partner for this and I would like for you to be equally discerning. This will only be fun for me if it is also fun for you as well.

If this might fit for you then please get in touch so we can see if we're a match. Please describe yourself briefly and attach a couple of pictures with your response.

Believe it or not, I am actually quite the opposite and you might actually get what you want. I will never have to prove myself to you or anyone because it is part of my character and a real man has nothing to prove but his all to be. I know I am attractive in my own quirky ways and I have never been shallow or one to pick someone based solely on looks. Besides, what man or woman wants to have the only deciding factor if they are a good man or woman based on their looks or physical appearance? There is much more to me than how I look, what kind of car I drive and how much I make. How about how I keep you interested? Treat you with respect? Make you happy in and out of the bedroom? I put myself out there but it is a shame as to how women really are these days by selling their bodies for weed, for rent money and for fancy bags and shoes. I don't complain about things like taking you out to dinner or driving miles to come see you. You never have to wonder where I am every night. I am not a sugar daddy. I am not a kid nor do I have a little boy mentality. I am not indecisive. I am not weak nor do I have a weak backbone. I am not disrespectful but I will not tolerate being disrespected. I am not a liar and I am actually very happy telling the truth. I am about furthering my education and bettering my mind, body and wallet. I absolutely won't settle for less. I will always encourage you to do your best. I don't let money or material things make me or break me. I am not perfect since I acknowledge my flaws and work on making myself better. I lead by example and follow with guidance. I pray and have faith but I don't think I am better than others because of my race or religion.

title: You'd be crazy or damaged to want me.
text:
This site has the been the basis of my sex and dating life for well over a decade. It's funny how you'll come across the same people here and on the shitty free dating sites still looking like they've always been, wondering why they can't, "find the right guy". The Internet is like this giant social experiment in its infancy and we're the first generation of guine pigs. As far as relationships go, I don't think it's going so well. "But my friend found her husband online and they're living happily ever after." Yes, your one individual example discounts the argument just like witnessing one, improbable coincidence proves it was, "God's grace". 

It's ok you're dysfunctional. It's ok the true love fantasy isn't in your cards. It's not really in anyone's, you just believe believe in fairytales at an advanced age. In reality a relationship is just an intricate game of give and take. In some the ratio is very lopsided and in others, it's pretty even. 

I'm a good guy in the fact that I'm never going to beat you. I'm never going to be cruel or scare you. I'd be nice to your kids. I wouldn't steal from or take advantage of you. I'm not going to fuck some random slut in your bed while you're at work. 

What scares and sickens me is that's a glowing endorsement to so many stupid women these days. Well, that's what they say they want, but invariably they'll find another scary, white trash junky just waiting for an opportunity to be alone with her 13 yo daughter. 

I'm not proud of much. I did have a very good thing going in life at one point, but in the end I was still me and that's what I couldn't handle. I can't regret the past or the choices I made because that person was bound to fuck things up one way or another. I think our free will is more of an illusion that we want to believe. We're objectively very predictable from a macro standpoint. More of a fixed track than an open road. 

I'm not bitter at the reality, I'm angry at the bullshit I was fed. I thought I could help someone change when in reality they're going to keep making the same mistakes until it kills them. I thought I was "in love" when in actuality it was a self-destructive obsession. I knew she was full of shit, batshit crazy, opiate dependent, non trustworthy, manipulative, self serving and incredibly immature. Like the emotional intelligence of a bratty, spoiled little girl. But who the fuck am I? Right? 

The misogynistic side of me will scold battered women for being so stupid for repeatedly subjecting themselves to the abuse. Then I realized how my situation paralleled theirs, I just didn't have any cuts or bruises jumping out at anyone. The damage was purely on my mental health and self worth as opposed to the wholistic approach the woman beaters use. 

I'm fat, dysfunctional, I don't fully support myself, not too much going on in any facet of my life, undereducated, and difficult to employ. If I'm not constantly checking and challenging my thoughts I'm a cruel knowitall. I'm fully able to get it together, I just don't know if it sounds worthwhile. That the incremental amount of happiness it'd bring is worth the risk or headache. 

Seriously, I'm not your existential anti-hero and I'd hold it against you if you were into me. I don't think I have too much to worry about 😊

*edit- I just proofread what I wrote and yes, I'm cringing every other sentence as well.

title: One More "First Kiss"
text:
Right up front, this posting is a long shot. What I seek is that rare chemistry between two people that makes minds wander and builds on itself, creating anticipation for every next step in the relationship. Whenever we find it, it is that first kiss we always remember more than anything else, because if we do it right that's the thing we waited for. 

I am an attractive, professional and highly educated guy with lots of interests, a fantastic sense of humor and a very sensitive side. My work and personal life keep me busy almost all of the time, and the responsibility I carry isolates me and makes me lonely even when I am with people. I want somebody who knows this feeling and needs a strong friendship in her life to give her a safe place to turn when the rest of the world just expects too much. I will give you that. In return I want the same kind of friendship, and regardless of how reckless it may seem I want to fall in love with you, stare into your eyes and know you are feeling the same thing. While physical attraction is a must, physical affirmation of the feelings is less important. If you are attached and can't follow through there will be no change in the way I feel about you or see you - rules are rules. I need your heart, your smile and your caring way more than I need your body. When you are with me in body or in spirit you will know you are beautiful, special and worshiped for who you are. When I am with you in body or in spirit I will know there is someone who cares about me, not what I can or cannot give them and only because she wants to.

You can be roughly my age or as young as you can be and still know what you want from this type of friendship. You can be any race. You need only be attractive to me (feel free to ask questions - I am not that picky but we all have our things) and be yourself. I will say that generally I am attracted to personality more than looks, but fitness is important to me. A nice body trumps fabulous shoes and hair! "Clicking" will require you are concerned with physical fitness, exercise and the outdoors. You have to be interested in something other than reality TV and it would be great if you enjoy witty banter and understand sarcasm. Be available to text message at different times in the day, and have maybe one day or evening a month you can sneak away for a drink and some laughs.

I have been privileged to have chatted with some very sweet and interesting ladies as a result of this post, I just have not been lucky enough yet to find the "one". I feel compelled to keep trying! 

Let's find each other and make some happiness in life, even if just for a while.

title: Pie Fight!
text:
I'm a SWM - 43, divorced a few years, no kids, no baggage, currently living on the North Side. After I got divorced, I made a list of things I wanted to try now that I was newly and unexpectedly single. One of those things - something I'd wanted to try for years - was a pie fight. That's not a euphemism. I'm talking about a man (me) and a woman (in theory, you) squaring off with a stack of whipped cream pies and throwing, smushing and smearing them in each other's faces and so on. I had no idea how to make that happen, so I posted an ad on CL for the hell of it. To my surprise, someone responded. She was cool, and we had a pie fight, and it was a blast. Better than I expected, and not the sort of thing I was content with doing only once. So I reposted my ad, and got more replies, and over the last few years pie fights have become a sort of irregular hobby for me. You're probably wondering why.
Have you ever hit another adult in the face with a pie? Or been hit with one yourself? Most people, if they're honest, would love to give it a try... but when? Where? Why? And at what cost to your relationship with the person in question? Be honest -- wouldn't you jump at the chance to hit another adult in the face with a pie if the adult in question, instead of being shocked and angry and upset, accepted the pastry-based comeuppance with a level head? (And then slapped a pie in *your* face to settle the score?) Trust me, there is no better way to blow off steam than doing something wacky with baked goods for an hour or so.
So what am I looking for? A woman, 25-50 ish, who's laid back, laughs easily and often, indulges freely in whimsy and isn't afraid to get really messy. We'll get together, perhaps enjoy a beverage or two, hurl a couple dozen pies at each other, laugh a lot, get cleaned up and... well, from there it depends on chemistry. I'm looking at this as a fun, platonic experience, and that's where my expectations end. If we get along, decide to get together again and it turns into something more down the road, that's great... but if it's a singular crazy experience, that's OK too. Look at it this way: you've probably had a few dozen first dates and meet-ups in your life, and you'll have more. Over time, they start to be sort of generic -- a coffee date here, a dinner there, a movie, whatever. Forgettable stuff. But whatever happens when we get together for this pie fight, I can promise you an experience that you won't forget. And not in a bad way.
The pie fight can take place in any private location that makes you comfortable (although my own ability to host is limited right now, so if you have a place in mind, that will make life much easier). Boundaries will be respected and discretion is assured. I'll pay for the pies, obviously, and I'll take care of the clean-up after it's over. You have only one responsibility, and that's to show up and have fun. Yes, technically that's two responsibilities, but if you do the first one, the second will take care of itself.
If you're still reading at this point, admit it: you're intrigued. You wouldn't have slogged through this long-ass ad if you weren't, would you? You've invested too much time at this point not to respond. Got questions? Respond to the ad and ask them. Think I'm a wackjob? Respond to the ad and tell me so. Hooked since halfway through the second paragraph and ready to go shopping for pies? Respond to the damn ad and we'll make a plan, OK? Whatever's on your mind, let's discuss it further.

title: The Reason That We Are Never Satisfied In Love.
text:
The world gives us a picture of "happily ever after." From our youth we men want to be the great knight or prince that slays the dragon and saves the maiden from it's clutches. 

Women want to be the princess that is saved by their hero. The perfect man, riding in to save his beloved, risking life and limb. 

It really is a great story, but it is a deceptive.

We men are far from the perfect Prince that women desire (can I get an "Amen?"). And women are far from that great, beautiful treasure that we desire to risk life and limb for. 

There is something wrong with trying to perceive romance from a distorted point of view. Some of you are here looking for that next romance that just might be your "Mr. right" or your "soul mate." When in actuality, a man might be able to give the appearance of being the Prince your heart desires, but when the honeymoon is past, you see that he does things that irritate the hell out of you. He's inconsiderate, doesn't care about your emotions, fights against your desires of how things should be done, and you now see a lot of flaws and discover that he is not much different from the last guy. He may be even worse. 

And we men want to sweep a woman off of her feet and when the honeymoon is over, we discover that her hair was dyed, her eyelashes were fake, her boobs were being held up by wires, the girdle kept the extra stuff from showing, her teeth come out at night, and when that make-up comes off, she just doesn't look the same as she did with those rose colored glasses...

If we are honest with ourselves and each other, no one measures up to the hope that we have for a "Happily Ever After" scenario. So what is my point? Love is not blind, but love forgives. Forgiveness is the key to truly being happy, because it is the willingness to work with what we have instead of looking for the illusive "perfect mate," or trying to shape the ne we have into a picture of what we want. 


The truth is that we have all been taken captive by a dragon. The problem is that the dragon is way more powerful than any of the sons of men, and there is not one among us that has the power to slay that dragon. The dragon is the one that has given us this false dream and hope of "Happily ever after" in this life that is full of evil. His name is Satan and his power over us is our own sin. We are all as that Bride bound in fetters, captive by the dragon and in need of salvation. There is a Prince that has come from a far country and laid down His life for His Bride. He committed no sin, so that He could gain the victory and power over the dragon. He has conquered the dragon and paid a high price to free His Bride from the dragon's cage. This is no fairy tale. It is the truth and Jesus Christ has gotten the victory to be able to wash His Bride's sins with His own blood. If anyone turns to Him for hope, He will never refuse you. He it is that will one day soon, return to destroy the dragon and all that have chosen to not accepet His gift of Love. The Word of God has been perfectly preserved from the beginning of creation unto the end. There are prophecies that He has given, so trhat we may know that His word is true and that we might trust in Him. Put not your hope in man. We will fail you. put your hope in God who has shown great Love in that He sent His only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in Him should not perish, but have everlasting life. He didn't come into the world to condemn the world, but that the world through Him might be saved. Seek forgiveness in His name. When you have found mercy, extend it to the one's in your life. For if we forgive not men their trespasses against us, neither will the Father forgive us our trespasses. And I would say that when we stand in judgment on that great day, if our sins are not forgiven and our name is not found in His book of life, we shall be cast into the Lake of fire where the dragon shall be. Get an Authorized King James Bible. These "New" Bibles are not the Word of God, they were skillfully changed by the dragon to hide many truths and to pervert His words. The dragon's time is short and he does not want you to be saved. The words of the Lord are pure words. 

"And the devil [the dragon] that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are, and shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever

If you confess with your mouth, the Lord Jesus Christ; and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you shall be saved. And the True Prince of Peace will come and make you His own and take you to be His when the day of great wrath comes. 

Rev 21: "And I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.And I John saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
And I heard a great voice out of heaven saying, Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and he will dwell with them, and they shall be his people, and God himself shall be with them, and be their God."


The true "Happily Ever After" comes "After" much trouble that is yet to come;)

Oh, and the dragon has seven heads and ten horns. He is not quite as the fairy tales depict.

title: You're married, but if you could.....
text:
......meet someone on the side and never get caught, would you consider exploring that relationship?

Let's pretend for a second that you're happily married with a normal and stable domestic life. Maybe you have kids, or you don't. You're a professional. You go to work and dress conservatively. You're attractive and take care of yourself but not one to flaunt it; you have manners and know how to behave in public. 

But there's a side of you that has yet to be explored. A side you're afraid to show or share with your husband. Perhaps he lacks interest. Perhaps you're afraid of his reaction. Perhaps you've both drifted apart in some ways over the years and you just don't want to share it with him. This side of you is not going away however. It creeps up now and then. Like an urge that continues to burn hotter and hotter with each passing day, week, month and now years. 

You've been with him and felt another man's eyes on you. His interest is elsewhere so you make quick eye contact and perhaps turn so he can see more of you. It's innocent of course and after a short few seconds your eyes part ways. But for those few seconds you felt alive and wanted. 

Do you miss that feeling? You may find it hard to believe but I feel the same way. I'm looking for someone with whom to explore those feelings and desires. 

A few details: I'm in my 40's, married (obviously) and white. I'm very well educated, a professional and we don't have kids. I prefer a woman in her 30 or 40's, white, also married, fit and attractive. 

Change the subject line to the today's date. Pics can be traded after we're comfortable with one another but your pic will get mine in return.

title: Married man for married woman
text:
I find myself seeking this and I hope I can find a woman who seeks the same. 

I will refrain from the usual nonsense about wanting to cuddle, how I want an emotional connection, etc. The truth is that I am quite content in marriage except for sex. I am hoping to find a woman who finds herself in the same situation. I want this to be primarily a physical relationship where we give one another that which we are missing in our current marriage/relationship. In fact, the less we get tangled emotionally the better; I want this to be truly an escape from what we current have and for it not to become another relationship which adds further burdens on our already busy lives. 

To that end, I am a well educated gentleman, professional, well groomed and dressed. I am attractive and fit. I seek the same from a woman. I love a professionally dressed woman! I also ask that you be either white, Asian or Indian. Just my preference. I am in my mid 40's and would prefer a woman in her 30's but I am flexible with that. Also, please be able to make time for something like this. If your family life and career consumes all your time, then this probably will not work. 

My hope is that we exchange a couple of emails, trade a pic so we can see of we're attracted to one another, perhaps text and talk on the phone and then meet for coffee. Think of that as an interview for both of us. 

If you send a pic I will reply with mine. I do ask that whenever that happens, you send first and I will respond in kind. Please tell me your favorite dessert in the subject line so I know you're real.

I realize that perhaps 10,000 sets of eyeballs will read this and 99.9% will have no interest. I'm hoping that the 0.1% that it does appeal to will take the plunge and at least say hello. You have nothing to lose. Good day.

title: Younger? Interested in older men? Look no further.
text:
The title says it all, but I'll elaborate. Save both our time if you're into games, as I am not. That said, if you're genuine, this can be mutually beneficial and possibly even turn into a full-on relationship.

Basically, I am not-that-young-anymore professional of 30. Single, white, fit, athletic (though on the thinner side), beard, piercings, and good-looking. Right now, I'm too busy with my own endeavors to put in the time with traditional dating. Furthermore, I'm interested in exploring a different dynamic with someone significantly younger and frankly, I hang out with people my own age.

Maybe you're just the type of girl who is into the older, professional type. Maybe you're bored with little boys and want a real gentleman with his act together. Maybe you're just kind of kinky. Regardless of what it is, I'm interested in hearing from you so long as you meet the following requirements:

-Legal
-Older high school to younger college age (let's say 21 or under, but exceptions can be made)
-Can hold a conversation
-Fun
-Attractive

Note that I put "attractive" last. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. If you take care of yourself, there is a good chance you have met that requirement. You don't have to be Barbie, and actually that's kind of a turn-off. People are imperfect and those imperfections are sexy. Plastic looks are not.

Keep in mind, this is not a sex ad, or I would put it under "casual encounters." In fact, the sex part of it would likely not happen right away. This is about the dynamic - whether it be you being spoiled and pampered, or whether it be something more aggressive and dominant. I'm experienced with and enjoy both ends.

So... if you've made it this far and think you are interested, reply back with an explanation of what you're about and what you're looking for, as well as a picture holding a sign with the word "younger" to weed out spam/fakes and show you can follow instructions.

And to the rest of you... Best of luck in finding what you are searching for. Cheers!

title: Marriage minded?
text:
Oh jeez, craigslist? Why not? I'm sure someone might be on the same page as I am, why not throw this out there. I've lived in Chicago for quite some time and think I'm ready to move back to my home state in a year or two. In short, I would like to meet someone that is interested in getting married and making this move with me. I know this is far-fetched, but let's see what happens? I would like to meet someone that is stable, educated, career focused and oriented. This doesn't mean, I'm only seeking people that make a certain amount of money. The biggest challenge for me is finding someone that is ready for an adult relationship. Please understand what an adult relationship is. If partying all night is your idea of fun, you are not what I am looking for. If you are happy working in a dead end job with no future and making no effort to improve yourself, there is a chance you also are not what I'm looking for. Again, just have something positive going on in your life career wise...that does not mean I'm basing life on salary.

About me. I'm always asked why I'm still single. I've dated here and there, but I seem to be missing a connection with people I meet. I have a great outlook on life, responsible, blended, active and quite funny. I'm not a materialist person and not looking for anyone that is stuck up or has her nose in the air. I think balance is the key word that best describes me and hope that you will understand what that means. By no means am I perfect. I have a great family with a wonderful relationship with everyone. 

I still have the house that I grew up in as a child, it's being leased out now. It's in a very nice older neighborhood, with a few beautiful parks within walking distance. There is a beautiful and historic park that I used to go running and biking in. The house was built by my family in 1921 and has been renovated up to modern standards, garage, back patio (awesome grill out area) and backyard. It's in a great city that I loved living up in, which has a great art and music background. It's a desired place to live in that city. This is "grown up" ready and no need for a "starter house" that many beginning couples face when buying their first home. 

About you: 20s/30s. I have a clean slate, no hang ups on an ex or dating anyone and expect the same from you. You will have my undivided attention. I do want children at some point, but I'd rather find someone that does not have kids and will want them in the near future. I do try to keep within a healthy lifestyle. Sorry if I'm being rude, but I'm not seeking overweight. This does not mean you have to be a gym freak...just keep within a healthy lifestyle. I'm 5'10, single, white and in average shape. Don't expect to me to be ready for the cover of the Firefighters Calendar! 

This gives you a glimpse of what to expect and what I have to offer. I want to start off with getting to know you and take it from there. I'm not interested in waiting years to realize what you want. If you think this is something you can see happening with yourself, please write back and tell me about yourself. Please make sure you include a picture and make sure that you give a good detail about yourself. If you don't feel comfortable giving that much and a picture, do not reply as I will take your reply as not serious. I have a direction in life that I want to move forward. All you have to do is jump on the idea with me and let's go. If you are the right person, I'll go more into detail about where this is and show plenty of pictures of what to look forward to.

Please put "Journey Together" in the subject so I know this is a real response.
